TEXT.TEXTVALUE: Point the mouse to each requirement of the experiment to know the name / Click the "Continue" button to start the experiment.
Take a micropipette.
Adjust the volume to 50 microlitre
A fresh tip is inserted.
The vial labeled as ‘Capture antibody solution’ is taken from the ice box.
The vial labeled as ‘Capture antibody solution’ is taken from the ice box.
The vial is opened and 50 microlitre of antibody solution is pipetted out.
The lid of the microtiter well plate is opened.
The antibody solution is poured into the first well.
Again,open the vial and pipette out 50µl of capture antibody solution.
Repeat the same for all the wells.
The antibody coated plate is wrapped with a plastic wrap to seal.
The coated well plate is wrapped with a plastic wrap to seal.
Take the microtitre plate and Incubate microtitre plate at 37°C for 2 hours.
Take the microtitre plate and Incubate microtitre plate at 37°C for 2 hours.
After 2hours, take out the plate from the incubator.
It is placed on the work bench and the plastic wrapper is removed.
Flick the coating solution into the plastic container.
Place the Microtitre well plate on the table top.
Take a multipipette.
Adjust the volume to 200 microlitre.
Insert fresh tips into the multipipette and open the flat vessel containing sterile distilled water.
200 microlitre of water is pipetted out using the multipipette.
Water is poured into the wells.
Again 200 microlitre of water is pipetted out using the multipipette.
The same procedure is repeated for all the wells.
The plate is gently swirled so as to wash the wells properly.
Water is flicked into the plastic container.
Keep the microtitre plate on a paper towel.
Flick it gently on the paper towel.
Place the well plate on the table top.
Washing is repeated two times.
Place the well plate on the table top.
Take the micropipette.
Adjust the volume to 200 microlitre.
Insert a fresh tip.
The bottle labeled as ‘Blocking Buffer’ is opened.
200 microlitre of blocking buffer solution is pipetted out.
Pour it into the microtitre well.
Again 200 microlitre of blocking buffer solution is pipetted out.
Repeat the same for all the wells.
Gently swirl the plate so as to wash the wells properly.
The plate is wrapped with plastic wrap to seal it.
The plate is wrapped with a plastic wrap to seal.
Incubate the well plate at room temperature for 30 minutes.
After 30 minutes incubation, the plastic wrapper is removed.
The blocking buffer solution is flicked into the plastic beaker.
Place the well plate on the table top.
Take a multipipette.
Insert fresh tips into the multipipette and open the flat vessel containing sterile distilled water.
200 microlitre of water is pipetted out using the multipipette.
Water is poured into the wells.
Washing is repeated three times.
Place the well plate on the table top.
Take the micropipette..
Adjust the volume to 50 microlitre.
Insert a fresh tip.
The vial labeled as ‘Antigen’ is taken from the ice box.
The vial labeled as ‘Antigen’ is taken from the ice box.
The vial is opened and 50 microlitre of antigen solution is pipetted out.
The antigen solution is poured into the first well.
The antigen solution is poured into the first well.
Again, open the vial and pipette out 50 microlitre of antigen.
Repeat the same for all the wells.
The antigen coated plate is wrapped with a plastic wrap to seal.
The antigen coated plate is wrapped with a plastic wrap to seal.
The plate is incubated for 2 hours at room temperature.
After 2 hours, the plastic wrapper is removed.
Flick the coating solution into the plastic container.
Place the Microtitre well plate on the table top.
Take a multipipette.
Insert fresh tips into the multipipette and open the flat vessel containing sterile distilled water.
200 microlitre of water is pipetted out using the multipipette.
Water is poured into the wells.
The same procedure is repeated for all the wells.
Place the well plate on the table top.
Washing is repeated two times.
Place the well plate on the table top.
Take the micropipette.
Adjust the volume to 200 microlitre.
Insert a fresh tip.
The bottle labeled as ‘Blocking Buffer’ is opened.
200 microlitre of blocking buffer solution is pipetted out.
Pour it into the microtitre well.
Again 200 microlitre of blocking buffer solution is pipetted out.
Repeat the same for all the wells.
Gently swirl the plate so as to wash the wells properly.
The plate is wrapped with a plastic wrap to seal.
The plate is wrapped with a plastic wrap to seal.
The plate is incubated for 10 minutes at room temperature.
After 10 minutes, the plastic wrapper is uncovered.
The blocking buffer solution is flicked into the plastic container.
Place the well plate on the table top.
Take a multipipette.
Insert fresh tips into the multipipette and open the flat vessel containing sterile distilled water.
200 microlitre of water is pipetted out using the multipipette.

Adjust the volume to 50 microlitre.
Insert a fresh tip.
The vial labeled as ‘Secondary Antibody’ is taken from the ice box.
The vial labeled as ‘Secondary Antibody’ is taken from the ice box.
The vial is opened and 50 microlitre of secondary antibody solution is pipetted out.
The secondary antibody solution is poured into the first well.
The secondary antibody solution is poured into the first well.
Again, open the vial and pipette out 50 microlitre of secondary antibody.
Repeat the same for all the wells.
The antigen coated plate is wrapped with a plastic wrap to seal it.
The antigen coated plate is wrapped with a plastic wrap to seal it.
The plate is incubated for 2 hours at room temperature.
After 2 hours, the plastic wrapper is uncovered.
Flick the coating solution into the plastic container.
Place the Microtitre well plate on the table top.

Insert fresh tips into the multipipette and open the flat vessel containing sterile distilled water.
200 microlitre of water is pipetted out using the multipipette.

Adjust the volume to 200 microlitre.
Insert a fresh tip.

Pour it into the microtitre well.

Repeat the same for all the wells.
Gently swirl the plate.
The well plate is wrapped with a plastic wrap to seal it.
The well plate is wrapped with a plastic wrap to seal it.
Incubate the microtiter plate for 10 minutes at room temperature.
After 10 minutes, remove the plastic wrapper.

Take a multipipette.
Insert fresh tips into the multipipette and open the flat vessel containing sterile distilled water.
200 microlitre of water is pipetted out using the multipipette.

Take the micropipette.
Adjust the volume to 75 microlitres.
Insert a fresh tip.
Take substrate vial from kept in ice box.
Take substrate vial from kept in ice box.
Pipette out 75 microlitre of the substrate bottle.
Pour it into the microtitre well.
Pour it into the microtitre well.
Pipette out 75 microlitre of the substrate bottle.
Repeat the same for all the wells.
The well plate is wrapped with a plastic wrap to seal it.
The well plate is wrapped with a plastic wrap to seal it.
Incubate the microtiter plate for 1 hour at room temperature.
After the incubated time, colour develops in some of the wells.
After the incubated time, colour develops in some of the wells.
Discard the used tip.
Adjust the volume of the pipette to 25 microlitres.
Insert a fresh tip.
Take stop solution vial from ice box.
Take stop solution vial from ice box.
Pipette out 25 microlitre of the stop solution from vial.
Pour it into the microtitre well.
Pour it into the microtitre well.
Again pipette out 25 microlitre of the stop solution from vial.
Pour 25 microlitre stop solution into each well of the plate.
Take the microtiter plate.
Place microtiter plate into the plate reader.
